comment: Helper class for performing the serialization / deserialization
codesample:
%REM
Converts a string of JSON to a Person object. The code is taken from the first deserialization example.
%REM
Dim json as String
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim jd as Person

json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42}|
Set jd = helper.fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;deser-10&quot;)

commenthtml: Helper class for performing the serialization / deserialization
inlinecomment: &apos; Helper class for performing the serialization / deserialization
codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Converts a string of JSON to a Person object. The code is taken from the first deserialization example.&lt;br /&gt;%REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim json as String&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()&lt;br /&gt;Dim jd as Person&lt;br /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42}|&lt;br /&gt;Set jd = helper.fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;deser-10&quot;)

methods.label: disableDebug
methods.comment: Disables debug printing, switched off by default.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Enables debug for the duration of converting a string of JSON to a Person, then disables debug again. The use case for this would be that deserialization is not working, so the developer is trying to trace progress to see where it is failing.
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Call helper.enableDebug()
Call helper.fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)
Call helper.disableDebug()
methods.signature: Sub disableDebug()
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Disables debug printing, switched off by default.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Disables debug printing, switched off by default.

The use case for this would be that deserialization is not working, so the developer is trying to trace progress to see where it is failing.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.enableDebug()&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.disableDebug()

%REM

%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Call helper.enableDebug()

methods.label: failSilently
methods.comment: Prevents throwing errors if deserialization / serialization fails, instead just aborts settings the properties.
methods.codesample:
%REM
This code converts a string of JSON to a Person object, ignoring any labels that do not have corresponding properties or incorrect data types.
%END REM
Dim json as String
Dim person as Person
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;: 42, &quot;gender&quot;: &quot;M&quot;}|
Call helper.failSilently()
Set person = helper.fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)
methods.signature: Sub failSilently()
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Prevents throwing errors if deserialization / serialization fails, instead just aborts settings the properties.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Prevents throwing errors if deserialization / serialization fails, instead just aborts settings the properties.
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Prevents throwing errors if deserialization / serialization fails, instead just aborts settings the properties.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;This code converts a string of JSON to a Person object, ignoring any labels that do not have corresponding properties or incorrect data types.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim json as String&lt;br /&gt;Dim person as Person&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()&lt;br /&gt;json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;: 42, &quot;gender&quot;: &quot;M&quot;}|&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.failSilently()&lt;br /&gt;Set person = helper.fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)

methods.label: fromJson
methods.comment: Main function to deserialize a JSON object to a VoltScript object.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Converts a VoltScript JsonObject to an instance of a class. A custom constructor, custom converters and configuration to ignore labels may be added before calling fromJson().
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Call helper.fromJson(jsonObj, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)

methods.label: fromJsonString
methods.comment: Parses JSON string and calls fromJson which creates an array or object.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Converts a string of JSON to an instance of a class. A custom constructor, custom converters and configuration to ignore labels may be added before calling fromJson().
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Dim js as Person
Dim json as String
json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42}|
Set jd = helper.fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)

methods.label: getCustomConverter
methods.comment: Returns the custom converter for a label, if it exists.
methods.codesample:
%REM
The code is an abbreviated version of code found in JsonConversionHelper.fromJson(). For a given JSON object (child) gets a converter based on the JSON object&apos;s label (elemName) and, if the converter exists, calls its deserialize method to convert the JSON object into mainHolder.
%END REM
Dim converter as AbstractJsonConverter
Dim elemName as String
elemName = child.label
Set converter = Me.getCustomConverter(elemName)
If Not converter is Nothing Then
    converter.deserialize(Me.mainHolder, child)
End If
methods.signature: Function getCustomConverter(labelName As String) As AbstractJsonConverter
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Returns the custom converter for a label, if it exists.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Returns the custom converter for a label, if it exists.
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Returns the custom converter for a label, if it exists.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;The code is an abbreviated version of code found in JsonConversionHelper.fromJson(). For a given JSON object (child) gets a converter based on the JSON object&apos;s label (elemName) and, if the converter exists, calls its deserialize method to convert the JSON object into mainHolder.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim converter as AbstractJsonConverter&lt;br /&gt;Dim elemName as String&lt;br /&gt;elemName = child.label&lt;br /&gt;Set converter = Me.getCustomConverter(elemName)&lt;br /&gt;If Not converter is Nothing Then&lt;br /&gt;    converter.deserialize(Me.mainHolder, child)&lt;br /&gt;End If

methods.label: ignoreLabel
methods.comment: Specifies a label to skip when parsing the JSON. The check is case-sensitive, so casing needs to match the casing in the JSON object.
methods.codesample:
%REM
When the helper parses all the labels in a JSON object to convert it from JSON to a VoltScript object, the code will skip the label &quot;ipaddress&quot;.
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Call helper.ignoreLabel(&quot;ipaddress&quot;)
methods.signature: Function ignoreLabel(labelToIgnore As String) As JsonConversionHelper

methods.label: jsonArrayToObjects
methods.comment: Converts an array to objects create with a constructor that takes no parameters.
methods.codesample:
%REM
This code is from deser-10.txt sample 4. Converts the JsonObject (obj) to a Variant array of Person objects.
%END REM
Dim parser as New JsonParser
Dim obj as JsonObject
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Dim arr as Variant
Call parser.loadFromJson(|{&quot;success&quot;: true, &quot;data&quot;: [{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42},{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;Jane&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:30}]}|)
Set obj = parser.getRootObject().getChild(&quot;data&quot;)
arr = helper.jsonArrayToObjects(obj, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)
methods.signature: Function jsonArrayToObjects(array As JsonObject, className As String, libName As String) As Variant

Converts the JsonObject (obj) to a Variant array of Person objects.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim parser as New JsonParser&lt;br /&gt;Dim obj as JsonObject&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper&lt;br /&gt;Dim arr as Variant&lt;br /&gt;Call parser.loadFromJson(|{&quot;success&quot;: true, &quot;data&quot;: [{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42},{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;Jane&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:30}]}|)&lt;br /&gt;Set obj = parser.getRootObject().getChild(&quot;data&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;arr = helper.jsonArrayToObjects(obj, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)

methods.label: reset
methods.comment: Resets the holder object containing the return value. This allows you to re-use the helper.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Uses a helper to deserialize JSON to a Person object, then resets it so it can be re-used by subsequent code. The mainHolder property will be re-initialized, but all converters or labels to ignore will still exist in the helper. So subsequent calls will also ignore &quot;gender&quot; label.
%END REM
Dim json as String
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim jd as Person
json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;M&quot;}|
Set jd = helper.ignoreLabel(&quot;gender&quot;).fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)
Call helper.reset()
methods.signature: Function reset() As JsonConversionHelper
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Resets the holder object containing the return value. This allows you to re-use the helper.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Resets the holder object containing the return value. This allows you to re-use the helper.
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Resets the holder object containing the return value. This allows you to re-use the helper.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Uses a helper to deserialize JSON to a Person object, then resets it so it can be re-used by subsequent code. The mainHolder property will be re-initialized, but all converters or labels to ignore will still exist in the helper. So subsequent calls will also ignore &quot;gender&quot; label.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim json as String&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()&lt;br /&gt;Dim jd as Person&lt;br /&gt;json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;M&quot;}|&lt;br /&gt;Set jd = helper.ignoreLabel(&quot;gender&quot;).fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.reset()

methods.label: shouldIgnoreLabel
methods.comment: Checks whether to skip a label when parsing the JSON
methods.codesample:
%REM
The code will print true for whether &quot;gender&quot; should be ignored, but false for &quot;firstName&quot;
%END REM
Dim json as String
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim jd as Person
json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;M&quot;}|
Set jd = helper.ignoreLabel(&quot;gender&quot;).fromJsonString(json, &quot;Person&quot;, &quot;PersonClass&quot;)
Print helper.shouldIgnoreLabel(&quot;gender&quot;)
Print helper.shouldIgnoreLabel(&quot;firstName&quot;)
methods.signature: Function shouldIgnoreLabel(labelName As String) As Boolean
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Checks whether to skip a label when parsing the JSON&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

methods.label: toJson
methods.comment: Main functon to serialize a VoltScript object / array to a JSON object
methods.codesample:
%REM
Creates a person and converts it to a JsonObject
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim jsonObj as JsonObject
Dim jd as New Person
jd.firstName = &quot;John&quot;
jd.lastName = &quot;Doe&quot;
jd.age = 42
Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;firstName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;age&quot;)
Set jsonObj = helper.toJson(jd)
methods.signature: Function toJson(obj As Variant) As JsonObject

methods.label: toJsonString
methods.comment: Main function to serialize a VoltScript object / array to a string
methods.codesample:
%REM
Creates a person and converts it to a string of pretty-printed JSON
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim jd as New Person
jd.firstName = &quot;John&quot;
jd.lastName = &quot;Doe&quot;
jd.age = 42
Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;firstName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;age&quot;)
Print helper.toJsonString(jd, true)
methods.signature: Function toJsonString(obj As Variant, prettify As Boolean) As String
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Main function to serialize a VoltScript object / array to a string&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Main function to serialize a VoltScript object / array to a string
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Main function to serialize a VoltScript object / array to a string
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Creates a person and converts it to a string of pretty-printed JSON&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()&lt;br /&gt;Dim jd as New Person&lt;br /&gt;jd.firstName = &quot;John&quot;&lt;br /&gt;jd.lastName = &quot;Doe&quot;&lt;br /&gt;jd.age = 42&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;firstName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;age&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Print helper.toJsonString(jd, true)

methods.label: toObject
methods.comment: Passes a JSON object to the helper and tells it what object type to create, defined in which file.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Creates a custom constructor to call a Pet&apos;s New method, which takes two parameters - name and type, in that order.
This code is found in deser-80 sample.
%END REM
Dim pet as Pet
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Dim petConstructor as New JsonCustomConstructor()
Call petConstructor.withParm(&quot;name&quot;, &quot;&quot;).withParam(&quot;type&quot;, &quot;&quot;)
Set pet = helper.withCustomCostructor(petConstructor)._
    toObject(source, &quot;Pet&quot;, &quot;deser-80&quot;)._
    fromJson(source)
methods.signature: Function toObject(source As JsonObject, className As String, libName As String) As JsonConversionHelper
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Passes a JSON object to the helper and tells it what object type to create, defined in which file.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Passes a JSON object to the helper and tells it what object type to create, defined in which file.
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Passes a JSON object to the helper and tells it what object type to create, defined in which file.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Creates a custom constructor to call a Pet&apos;s New method, which takes two parameters - name and type, in that order.&lt;br /&gt;This code is found in deser-80 sample.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim pet as Pet&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper&lt;br /&gt;Dim petConstructor as New JsonCustomConstructor()&lt;br /&gt;Call petConstructor.withParm(&quot;name&quot;, &quot;&quot;).withParam(&quot;type&quot;, &quot;&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Set pet = helper.withCustomCostructor(petConstructor)._&lt;br /&gt;    toObject(source, &quot;Pet&quot;, &quot;deser-80&quot;)._&lt;br /&gt;    fromJson(source)

methods.label: withArrayConverter
methods.comment: Adds an array converter to this object
methods.codesample:
%REM
The following code is from ser-20.txt sample 1. Converts a Session object to a String, outputting &quot;id&quot; and &quot;title&quot; as strings, and using an arrayConverter to convert the &quot;products&quot; property of the Session (a Variant array) to a JSON array.
%END REM
Dim sess as New Session
Dim json as String
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
sess.id = &quot;Ad16&quot;
sess.title = &quot;Collaborate around Business Applications in Communities&quot;
sess.products = Split(&quot;Domino,Connections,Volt&quot;, &quot;,&quot;)
Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;id&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;title&quot;).withArrayConverter(&quot;products&quot;)
json = helper.toJsonString(sess, true)
methods.signature: Function withArrayConverter(labelName As String) As JsonConversionHelper
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Adds an array converter to this object&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Adds an array converter to this object
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Adds an array converter to this object
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;The following code is from ser-20.txt sample 1. Converts a Session object to a String, outputting &quot;id&quot; and &quot;title&quot; as strings, and using an arrayConverter to convert the &quot;products&quot; property of the Session (a Variant array) to a JSON array.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim sess as New Session&lt;br /&gt;Dim json as String&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper&lt;br /&gt;sess.id = &quot;Ad16&quot;&lt;br /&gt;sess.title = &quot;Collaborate around Business Applications in Communities&quot;&lt;br /&gt;sess.products = Split(&quot;Domino,Connections,Volt&quot;, &quot;,&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;id&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;title&quot;).withArrayConverter(&quot;products&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;json = helper.toJsonString(sess, true)

methods.label: withCustomConstructor
methods.comment: Passes a custom constructor to use to create the object during deserialization
methods.codesample:
%REM
The code below calls the Session class&apos;s New method passing two parameters, the JSON object&apos;s &quot;id&quot; and &quot;title&quot; elements, in that order.
The code can be found in the deser-70.txt example.
%END REM
Dim sess as Session
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Dim sessionConstructor as New JsonCustomConstructor
Dim json as String
  
json = |{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;Ad01&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Domino HA&quot;}|
Call sessionConstructor.withParam(&quot;id&quot;, &quot;&quot;).withTitle(&quot;title&quot;, &quot;&quot;)
Set sess = helper.withCustomConstructor(sessionConstructor).fromJsonString(json, &quot;Session&quot;, &quot;deser-70&quot;)
methods.signature: Function withCustomConstructor(constructor As JsonCustomConstructor) As JsonConversionHelper
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Passes a custom constructor to use to create the object during deserialization&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;

methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Passes a custom constructor to use to create the object during deserialization
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;The code below calls the Session class&apos;s New method passing two parameters, the JSON object&apos;s &quot;id&quot; and &quot;title&quot; elements, in that order.&lt;br /&gt;The code can be found in the deser-70.txt example.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim sess as Session&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper&lt;br /&gt;Dim sessionConstructor as New JsonCustomConstructor&lt;br /&gt;Dim json as String&lt;br /&gt;  &lt;br /&gt;json = |{&quot;id&quot;:&quot;Ad01&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;Domino HA&quot;}|&lt;br /&gt;Call sessionConstructor.withParam(&quot;id&quot;, &quot;&quot;).withTitle(&quot;title&quot;, &quot;&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Set sess = helper.withCustomConstructor(sessionConstructor).fromJsonString(json, &quot;Session&quot;, &quot;deser-70&quot;)

methods.label: withCustomConverter
methods.comment: Adds a custom converter to this object
methods.codesample:
%REM
Ensures that when extracting the gender element from a JSON object, the target class&apos;s setGender method is called with the literal value &quot;M&quot;. 
This is found in the CustomSetterTest sample, a hard-coded test for validation purposes only.
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper
Dim genderConverter as New JsonSetterConverter()
Call genderConverter.forSetter(setGender).withLiteralParam(&quot;M&quot;)
Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;gender&quot;, genderConverter)
methods.signature: Function withCustomConverter(labelName As String, converter As AbstractJsonConverter) As JsonConversionHelper
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Adds a custom converter to this object&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Adds a custom converter to this object
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Adds a custom converter to this object
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Ensures that when extracting the gender element from a JSON object, the target class&apos;s setGender method is called with the literal value &quot;M&quot;. &lt;br /&gt;This is found in the CustomSetterTest sample, a hard-coded test for validation purposes only.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper&lt;br /&gt;Dim genderConverter as New JsonSetterConverter()&lt;br /&gt;Call genderConverter.forSetter(setGender).withLiteralParam(&quot;M&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.withCustomConverter(&quot;gender&quot;, genderConverter)

methods.label: withObject
methods.comment: Passes an existing object into the helper, so you can merge content from an additional JSON object into it.
methods.codesample:
%REM
Converts a string of JSON to a Person object. The code is taken from the first deserialization example.
%REM
Dim json as String
Dim parser as New JsonParser
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim jd as New Person
json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42}|
Call parser.loadFromJson(json)
Call helper.withObject*jd).fromJson(parser.getRootObject)
methods.signature: Function withObject(object As Variant) As JsonConversionHelper
methods.commentblock: &lt;div class=&quot;description&quot;&gt;	&lt;ul class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;		&lt;li class=&quot;blockList&quot;&gt;			&lt;div class=&quot;comments&quot;&gt;&lt;!-- comment --&gt;&lt;pre&gt;Passes an existing object into the helper, so you can merge content from an additional JSON object into it.&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/div&gt;			&lt;hr /&gt;		&lt;/li&gt;	&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
methods.commenthtml: Passes an existing object into the helper, so you can merge content from an additional JSON object into it.
methods.inlinecomment: &apos; Passes an existing object into the helper, so you can merge content from an additional JSON object into it.
methods.codesamplehtml: %REM&lt;br /&gt;Converts a string of JSON to a Person object. The code is taken from the first deserialization example.&lt;br /&gt;%REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim json as String&lt;br /&gt;Dim parser as New JsonParser&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()&lt;br /&gt;Dim jd as New Person&lt;br /&gt;json = |{&quot;firstName&quot;:&quot;John&quot;,&quot;lastName&quot;:&quot;Doe&quot;,&quot;age&quot;:42}|&lt;br /&gt;Call parser.loadFromJson(json)&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.withObject*jd).fromJson(parser.getRootObject)

arguments.label: object
arguments.comment: Object to merge properties into
arguments.commenthtml: Object to merge properties into
arguments.inlinecomment: &apos; Object to merge properties into

methods.label: withScalarConverter
methods.comment: Adds a scalar converter to this object
methods.codesample:
%REM
Creates a person and converts it to a JsonObject. Converts strings to JSON strings, numerics to JSON numbers.
%END REM
Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()
Dim jsonObj as JsonObject
Dim jd as New Person
jd.firstName = &quot;John&quot;
jd.lastName = &quot;Doe&quot;
jd.age = 42
Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;firstName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;age&quot;)
Set jsonObj = helper.toJson(jd)
methods.signature: Function withScalarConverter(labelName As String) As JsonConversionHelper

Converts strings to JSON strings, numerics to JSON numbers.&lt;br /&gt;%END REM&lt;br /&gt;Dim helper as New JsonConversionHelper()&lt;br /&gt;Dim jsonObj as JsonObject&lt;br /&gt;Dim jd as New Person&lt;br /&gt;jd.firstName = &quot;John&quot;&lt;br /&gt;jd.lastName = &quot;Doe&quot;&lt;br /&gt;jd.age = 42&lt;br /&gt;Call helper.withScalarConverter(&quot;firstName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;lastName&quot;).withScalarConverter(&quot;age&quot;)&lt;br /&gt;Set jsonObj = helper.toJson(jd)
